greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number m such that phi(m) = n*tau(m), with phi=A000010 and tau=A000005; a(n)=0 if no such m exists.
comment: If p = 2*n+1 is a prime, and if n > 1 then a(n)=p.
link: Enrique Pérez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
formula: If n > 1 then a(n) >= 2*n+1 or a(n)=0.
If p and q = 2*p+1 are both prime, A005384, then a(p) = 2*p+1.
If p > 3 and q = 4*p+1 are both prime, A023212, then a(p) = 8*p + 2 = 2*q.
If p > 2 is prime and both 2*p+1 and 4*p+1 are composite, A043297, then a(n)=0.
mathematica: k_ /; MissingQ@ k -> 0, {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 09 2017, Version 10.2 *)
results.author: _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Aug 05 2010
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 07 2010
